entry.et: Middle English speche, from Old English sprǣc, spǣc; akin to Old English sprecan to speak speak

def.dt: :the communication or expression of thoughts in spoken words
:an individual manner or style of speaking
:the power of expressing or communicating thoughts by speaking
:a group of people sharing characteristic patterns of vocabulary, grammar, and pronunciation

:a form of expression (as a simile or metaphor) used to convey meaning or heighten effect often by comparing or identifying one thing with another that has a meaning or connotation familiar to the reader or listener
:speech that is protected by the First Amendment to the United States Constitution
:the right to such speech an unconstitutional restraint on free speech National Law Journal
:a traditional class of words distinguished according to the kind of idea denoted and the function performed in a sentence
:a set of phonetic symbols based on symbols for articulatory position
